title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 12 ยง 250.12 - Computing time
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 12 ยง 250.12 - Computing time

State Regulations
(a) The term
days, as used in this Chapter, shall refer to
calendar days. (b) The term
working days, as used in this Chapter, shall not include a

Saturday, a Sunday, or a legal State or federal holiday. (c) In computing any period of time
prescribed or allowed by these rules, or by order or direction, the day of the
act, event, or default after which the designated period of time begins to run
shall not be included. The last day of the period so computed shall be
included, unless it falls on a Saturday, a Sunday, or a legal State or federal
holiday, in which event the period shall run to the next working day. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 12
ยง
250.12

Adopted

New

York State Register February 15, 2023/Volume XLV, Issue 07, eff. 2/15/2023

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
